accelerated higher, now approaching 5%. It is now at its highest rate since 2007 and is
quickly pushing up borrowing costs elsewhere. The fixed-rate 30-year mortgage rate has
climbed close to 8%, its highest since 2000.
The FOMC hasn’t lifted its policy rate since July, but longer-dated interest rates have not
only kept going, but picked up steam. Deciphering exactly why is more art than science.
Investors appear to have come to the realization that elevated inflation is set to stick
around longer than previously assumed. The U.S. economy has proven less responsive to
